intro: Bomarea hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy bomarea, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the family Alstroemeriaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, showy inflorescences. The plant features tubular, violet-blue flowers that are often clustered in terminal racemes. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered with fine hairs, contributing to its common name. Bomarea hirsuta is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests.
